comment.text:
better! 
if only I could switch off that silly date format am/pm in mail/news.  I can choose between US or US in this (and prev version). Guess what I did choose?

Browser and mail/news work fine for me.

@notandor: Set LANG=whatever and choose Regional settings in Appearance.
LANG=us_NL.UTF-8 does work! Only for time, date is now 'hidden' (I want text in US, previous LC_TIME =nl did the job)

@notandor: First, make sure you have "intl.locale.matchOS" set to false (non-default) in about:config
(Else all the things will be in the same locale everywhere).
Then choose the preferred locale manually in Preferences-->Appearence (US in your case).
Then you can start SM with either LC_ALL=whatever or LC_MESSAGES=whatever, and choose the proper "regional settings", which appears to be "whatever"...
Hi buc, that works, thx for the recipe: you make my day!!

@notandor: Seems to be even more easy -- try to preserve "intl.locale.matchOS" as default (ie. true), and just run SeaMonkey with LC_MESSAGES=C (and probabaly LC_TIME=C). Actually en_US wiil be used for UI, but no am/pm for times...

The easiest would have been no change at all e.g. if it still honered the LC_TIME! Next is  documenting the change somewhere findable. But in the end this fall back is enjoyable! Happy again with something that already worked,,, with a human touch.

Yep, it seems fixed in Firefox in https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1409158
I'll try to backport it in the next release.
fyi  LC_MESSAGES=C doesn't seem to work for me. Also keep in mind that not only am/pm but also us date sequence looks alien to me. Like I drank too many imperial teaspoon  pints

notes:
Update to 2.53.2

If you have Lightning and/or Chatzilla extensions previously disabled, they are enabled after the update. Disable it again if needed (in about:addons), or remove completely (which can improve startup time).
